text: [Music]
it's a loaded question with me actually
because um I'm I'm from Iran originally
I was born there um and the first
several years of my life we we lived
there and the plan was to stay there of
course the Islamic revolution uh messed
that up and so uh we moved to Los
Angeles I was raised in Los Angeles um
but my formative years were actually
spent in New York from 18 onwards so I
have a sort of ultra hyphenated identity
I guess as Iranian American and um Los
Angelino and New Yorker or B Coastal
bicultural well at the time of the
hostage crisis they were still in Iran
um and
they because my my mother and my father
were both educated um abroad to a degree
they you know when they got to the US
they spoke English they were able to um
work here um it it wasn't horrible um
but for them a lot of the fear came in
just getting out of Iran you know the
airports were shut down when they tried
to to get out because of the Iran Iraq
war and um you know they were
basically sort of gypsies through much
of Europe you know they were in in
Turkey then they were from there they
went to France the Germany you know and
then they just finally went to Los
Angeles by default because that's what
all the Iranians were doing um but it
wasn't so bad for them and I imagine it
wasn't so bad for a lot of Iranians
because they all thought this was
temporary you know they didn't even they
only had two suitcases with them um so
and all their stuff is still in a house
they own in Iran to this day that's left
pretty much untouched everything as it
was when they fled because when when
they people talk about Iranians fleeing
they they really did flee um some of
them made the decision quite rapidly for
some of for some people like my family
it was almost overnight a decision
because it really never seemed like he
would be
permanent um that's a very tricky
question as well um I as I get older I I
tend to become more
Iranian um
but I guess I've I've now since the
novel came out been forced to consider
myself as an Iranian American more and
more so my family is fairly traditional
Iranian family um but the novel really
split me into um made me sort of
consider being a Californian and and a
New Yorker so in some ways I emerged
more confused than ever
